result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George E. Wood Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George E. Wood in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16CF274, 16CF284, 16CF173 & 15CM207
16CF274 - Motion to amend count 1 to 961.573(1) by State - Granted by court - Plea no contest to counts 1 & 2 - Count 3 DRI
16CF173 - Count 1 - Plea no contest - Count 2 DRI (Deferred entry of judgment)
16CF284 - DRI
15CM207 - DRI
Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court of counts in 16CF274, credit for 89 days jail if revoked- 16CF173 Found guilty but Judgement deferred - Deferred entry of judgment agreement approved by court - Conditions read as provided in Deferred order - 
Arguments by Bayne-Allison/Abernethy-Mays/Court to sentencing - Court reviews restrictions of felony conviction if Deferred Judgment is revoked - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation - AODA and follow thru with recommended treatment - May not possess or consume intoxicants - May not be on tavern premises - CC/SC - Post conviction rights given - Defendant check in to probation tomorrow morning -
AMG

Defendant George E. Wood in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CFR284, 16CF173, 15CM207 - Statements by defendant - Defendant had contacted the public defenders offices and they said Ms. Abernethy-Mays would represent but he hasn't heard anything from her - Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today - Officer Josh McCaskill called - Sworn - Direct by Dunphy - Defendant identified by witness - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt - Court will put over arraignment for another date - Defendant requests bond modification - Arguments by Dunphy - Arguments by defendant - Defendant would be living with mother if released from custody - Court denies motion to reduce bond at this time -  Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Subpoena
Hearing on November 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant George E. Wood in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Warrant is quashed.  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft does not appear.  Is in Marshfield babysitting.  State is requesting a bench warrant.  Court grants the bench warrant.
Jury trial on January 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.
notice of hearing for Status Conf 8/24/16

Deft is to live with mother at 704 Wisconsin Street, Merrill, WI  54452

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense attorney has not been able to contact the deft.  Mother addresses the court.  Court directs the mother to go get the deft for court.  Back on the record at 9:22 am.  State recalls the case and gives the appearances.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Defense attorney addresses the court.  Could not make contact with the deft.   Court leaves the courtroom to give parties time to talk about a agreement.  All parties left at 9:31 am  Back on the record at 9:36 am  No agreement has been reached on the case.  State addresses the court do to a bond violation.  State wants the bond to  be modified so the deft will be held more responsible.  Mother Amy Wood addresses the court.  Clerk does give the deft a change of address form.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, George E. Wood appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed before served.  Deft explains why he was not here.  Bond is reinstated.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant George E. Wood not in court.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  No appearances.  The attorney has withdrawn.  Victim rights have been complied with. The requests a bench warrant.  Court grants the request.  The mother of the deft addresses the court.
